item.title: how to make a cut
item.description: Sometimes you have to be technical with how you approach your cut, going in with your saw blazing mates it difficult to put things back together. ![[assembled.jpeg]] My approach has been the following; Clean back as much as possible to expose how the joints are formed. Make a mental model of what I need to replace (there is a lot in this case) Drill reassembly holes for Cleo fasteners Remove spot welds (punch, drill, spot weld cutter) Remove panels I ended up exposing the large section that I need to remove.
